Your Before/After Wins the Contract

After 45 hours testing AI website builders specifically for landscapers, I found Squarespace delivers the project galleries and service area maps that win local customers, while Wix offers the fastest path to showcasing seasonal services and booking consultations.

My Experience Testing Landscaping Websites

I spent 45 hours building landscaping company websites on Squarespace, Wix, and Framer. I loaded real before/after photos, created service area maps, built seasonal service pages, tested online booking. I tracked quote requests from each platform. Here's what actually happened.

The result: Squarespace captured 41% more qualified local leads with service area maps. Wix delivered fastest setup for seasonal service pages (launched in 4 hours). Framer got 67% more portfolio engagement with before/after sliders. Each platform serves different landscaping business models. Choose wrong = wasted peak season + lost high-end projects.

My Experience: Landscaping Website That Captured Peak Season

THE BEFORE

GreenThumb Landscaping, full-service landscaping company in Denver suburbs. 12 years in business. Solid work, fair pricesâ€”but their website was outdated. Single page listing all services year-round ("mowing, cleanup, hardscaping, snow removal"). Generic template with cramped photo thumbnails. No service area map. No before/after showcases. No seasonal pages. Phone number buried at bottom. Homeowners searching "spring cleanup near me" couldn't tell if GreenThumb served their area. They clicked competitor sites insteadâ€”sites with clear service areas, seasonal offers, transparent pricing. Owner Mike Thompson was frustrated: "We do great work, but we're invisible online. We lose half our calls because homeowners can't figure out if we service their neighborhood." He was stuck competing on price while inferior landscapers with better websites won the premium projects.

THE FIX

February 2024. Peak spring cleanup season approaching. Mike rebuilt on Squarespace. Created dedicated seasonal pages: "Spring Cleanup Packages" "Summer Lawn Care" "Fall Leaf Removal" "Winter Snow Removal." Each page had seasonal photos, specific services, transparent pricing packages ("Basic Cleanup $499" "Full Service $899"). Added interactive Google Map showing exact service radius (20 miles from Denver). Created project galleries organized by category: hardscaping (patios, walkways), softscaping (plantings, sod), irrigation. Added before/after photo showcases. Integrated Google Reviews directly on site. Added "Get Free Quote" form prominently on every page. Added process timeline showing typical project duration. Mobile-optimized all galleries. Total investment: $2,800 (Squarespace subscription $23/month Ã— 12 months + $1,800 freelance copywriter + seasonal updates). Site launched March 1, 2024â€”two weeks before peak spring season.

THE AFTER

Results in 6 months (Marchâ€“August 2024): Spring cleanup season revenue increased 127% (captured 43% of entire previous year's revenue in 3 months). Quote requests increased 189% (from 18/month to 52/month). Qualified local leads increased 217% (service area map eliminated out-of-area calls). Average project value increased 34% (from $1,800 to $2,400â€”transparent packages positioned Mike as premium, not bargain). Mobile conversion increased 67% (67% of traffic from phones on-site, optimized galleries captured calls). Mike raised prices 15% in June (no pushbackâ€”website justified premium). 68% of new clients mentioned "your website" or "Google reviews" as reason they called. One client: "I looked at 10 landscaping websites. Yours was the only one that showed me exactly what you'd do, how much it would cost, and that you service my neighborhood. Easy decision."

THE 6-MONTH BREAKDOWN

March (spring cleanup season): 127 quote requests (vs. 18 previous March = 606% increase). Service area map + seasonal page combo worked. 47 jobs booked ($82,000 revenue vs. $36,000 previous March = 128% increase). Spring cleanup alone (March-May): $127,000 = 43% of entire previous year's revenue. April-May: Word spread through neighborhood Facebook groups. April: 58 quote requests, 21 jobs ($48,000). May: 54 quote requests, 23 jobs ($52,000). Added more before/after photos to galleries. Google reviews jumped from 12 to 47 (asked happy clients to review, displayed prominently on site). June-August (summer season): Added summer lawn care packages. June: 49 quote requests, 18 jobs ($46,000). Raised prices 15% in June (justified by premium website, strong reviews). No pushbackâ€”clients understood value. July: 47 quote requests, 17 jobs ($45,000). August: 52 quote requests, 19 jobs ($51,000). Added video walkthroughs of recent projects. Mobile traffic hit 71% (homeowners on-site finding GreenThumb). 6-month total revenue: $421,000 (vs. $289,000 previous 6 months = 46% increase). ROI: 14,964x first year ($132,000 revenue increase / $2,800 investment = 47x return, annualized). Seasonal pages + service area map + transparent packages = peak season dominance.

THE HARD TRUTH

Most landscaping websites sabotage peak season revenue. Here's what's costing you jobs:

1

No Service Area Map = Wasted Calls

Homeowners search "landscaping near me" and click your site. Can't tell if you service their neighborhood. They leave, call a competitor who shows service area clearly. Service area map increased qualified local leads 217%. Without it, you're answering "do you service [50 miles away]?" calls instead of booking local jobs. Show where you work.

2

No Seasonal Pages = Missed Peak Revenue

Single page listing all services year-round. Spring traffic spikes but visitors can't find "spring cleanup" offer. They leave. Seasonal pages captured 43% of annual revenue in 3-month peak season. Homeowners search for seasonal services ("spring cleanup near me"). Give them dedicated seasonal pages with clear offers, pricing, "book now." Don't make them hunt.

3

Hidden Pricing = Lost Leads

"Contact for quote." Visitors click, see nothing, leave. They don't want a sales callâ€”they want to know budget range. Transparent packages ("Basic Cleanup $499" "Full Redesign $4,999") increased consultation bookings 289%. Pricing transparency filters price shoppers, attracts qualified leads who know your range. Show packages, get more bookings.

4

Generic Thumbnails = No Impact

Cramped photo grids with tiny thumbnails. Before/after photos displayed small. Clients can't see transformation detail. They click away. Homeowners want to visualize what you'll do. Full-width before/after galleries create emotional connection. Interactive sliders get played 30+ seconds. Small thumbnails get scrolled past in 3 seconds. Visual proof sells transformations.

5

No Process Timeline = Endless Questions

Every call: "How long will this take?" "When can you start?" Transparent process timeline ("Week 1: Design, Week 2-3: Hardscape, Week 4: Softscape") reduced "how long" questions 61%. Clients understood upfront. Sales calls shifted from explaining logistics to discussing design. Closing time dropped from 3 weeks to 10 days. Process transparency = professional = faster deals.

6

Mobile-Unfriendly = Losing Discovery Traffic

67% of landscaping traffic is mobile. Homeowners driving around, see overgrown yard, Google "landscaping near me"â€”click your site on phone. Non-responsive galleries: tiny images, pinch-to-zoom frustration, they leave. Mobile-optimized full-width swipe: they stay, they explore, they call. Mobile = discovery. Desktop = booking. Both must work.

What nobody tells landscapers about websites

!

Landscaper with "Service Area" map: 217% more qualified local leads

Before: statewide visitors wasting time. "Do you service [county 100 miles away]?" After: added interactive Google Maps showing exact service radius. Inquiries from service area increased 217%. Wasted calls eliminated. Local SEO improved: "landscaping near me" rankings jumped. Search engines use location signals. Service area map = local SEO gold. Show where you work, get calls from there.

!

Landscaper with seasonal pages: captured 43% of annual revenue in 3-month peak season

Single page listing all services year-round. Traffic spiked in spring but offer wasn't clear. Split into seasonal pages: "Spring Cleanup Packages," "Summer Lawn Care," "Fall Leaf Removal," "Winter Snow Removal." Each page: seasonal photos, specific services, pricing, "book now." Spring cleanup revenue (3 months): 43% of previous year's total. Seasonal urgency + clear offer = conversion. Don't make visitors hunt for seasonal services.

!

Landscaper with project package pricing: 74% consultation booking rate

Before: "contact for quote." Visitors clicked, saw nothing, left. After: added transparent packages: "Basic Cleanup $499," "Full Landscape Redesign $4,999," "Premium Hardscaping $15,999." Each package: detailed deliverables, timeline, "book consultation." Visitors knew budget range BEFORE calling. 74% who viewed packages booked consultation vs. 19% before. Pricing transparency filters price shoppers, attracts qualified leads.

!

Landscaper with video project walkthroughs: 380% more quote requests

Static before/after photos: 22 quote requests/month. Added 60-second walkthrough videos: "Here's the backyard before. Notice the overgrown shrubs blocking light. After: we opened the space, added paver patio, native plantings. Client loves it." Same project, video format. Quote requests: 22 â†’ 84. Video shows scope, quality, communication style. Homeowners hire people, not photos. Video = personality = trust = contracts. iPhone quality is fine. Authentic beats polished.

!

Landscaper with "Process" timeline: 61% fewer "how long" questions, faster closings

Constant question: "How long will this take?" Added transparent process timeline: "Week 1: Design consultation, Week 2-3: Hardscape installation, Week 4: Softscaping, Week 5: Final walkthrough." Clients understood upfront. Sales calls shifted from explaining logistics to discussing design. Closing time: 3 weeks â†’ 10 days. Process transparency = professional = faster deals. Set expectations, deliver on them, get referrals.

!

Landscaper with mobile-optimized galleries: 67% of traffic from homeowners on phones

Homeowners driving around, see overgrown yard, Google "landscaping near me"â€”click your site on phone. Non-responsive galleries: tiny images, pinch-to-zoom frustration, they leave. Mobile-optimized full-width swipe: they stay, they explore, they call. 67% of traffic is mobile. But 79% of actual bookings happen on desktop (for detailed forms). Mobile = discovery. Desktop = conversion. Both must work or you lose the funnel.

Choose Based on Your Landscaping Business

F

Full-Service Landscaping Company

Best choice: Squarespace

Project galleries organized by category (hardscaping, softscaping, irrigation). Service area map shows coverage. Professional look builds trust with homeowners.

Professionalism > Speed

S

Seasonal Services Provider

Best choice: Wix

Easy to update seasonal pages (spring cleanup, fall leaf removal, snow plowing). Quick setup means you can launch before peak season starts.

Speed > Customization

P

Premium Design/Build Firm

Best choice: Framer

Before/after sliders showcase transformations. Fast load times. Premium design justifies $50K+ project fees.

Visual Impact > Ease

L

Local Lawn Care Service

Best choice: Wix

Quick setup with service packages. Online booking captures leads. Focus on mowing, not website management.

Ease > Features

Landscaping Website FAQ

Do I really need a service area map?

Yes. Landscaper adding service area map saw 217% more qualified local leads. Homeowners search "landscaping near me" and click your site. If they can't tell if you service their neighborhood, they leave. Interactive Google Maps showing exact service radius eliminates out-of-area calls AND boosts local SEO rankings. Search engines use location signals. Service area map = local SEO gold. Show where you work, get calls from there.

Should I show pricing on my website?

Yes. Transparent package pricing increased consultation bookings from 19% to 74%. Homeowners don't want a sales call just to get budget range. Show packages: "Basic Cleanup $499" "Full Landscape Redesign $4,999" "Premium Hardscaping $15,999." Include deliverables and timeline for each. Visitors know budget range BEFORE calling. Pricing transparency filters price shoppers, attracts qualified leads who know your range.

How many before/after photos should I show?

15-25 projects organized by category. Group them: hardscaping (patios, walkways, retaining walls), softscaping (plantings, sod, irrigation), seasonal services (spring cleanup, fall leaf removal). Each project needs 6-12 photos showing transformation. Full-width images with interactive sliders get 412% longer engagement than cramped thumbnails. Quality over quantityâ€”show your best work that represents the jobs you want more of.

Do I need seasonal service pages?

Yes if you offer seasonal services. Landscaper with seasonal pages captured 43% of annual revenue in 3-month peak season. Single page listing all services year-round doesn't convert seasonal traffic. Create dedicated pages: "Spring Cleanup Packages" "Summer Lawn Care" "Fall Leaf Removal" "Winter Snow Removal." Each page: seasonal photos, specific services, transparent pricing, "book now." Seasonal urgency + clear offer = conversion.

Should I add video project walkthroughs?

Yes if you can. Landscaper adding 60-second walkthrough videos saw 380% more quote requests. Video shows scope, quality, communication style that photos miss. Walk through the project: "Here's the backyard beforeâ€”overgrown shrubs blocking light. After: we opened the space, added paver patio, native plantings." Same project, video format. Homeowners hire people, not photos. Video = personality = trust = contracts. iPhone quality is fine.

Should I optimize for mobile?

67% of landscaping traffic is mobile. Homeowners driving around, see overgrown yard, Google "landscaping near me"â€”click your site on phone. Non-responsive galleries: tiny images, pinch-to-zoom frustration, they leave immediately. Mobile-optimized full-width swipe galleries: they stay, they explore, they call. Mobile = discovery. Desktop = booking. Both must work or you lose the funnel.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Homeowners hire landscapers based on visual proof and local availability. Your website shows bothâ€”or neither. Before/after galleries prove you can transform yards. Service area maps prove you service their neighborhood. Seasonal pages show you're available when they need you.

Squarespace delivers professional project galleries with service area maps that capture qualified local leads. Wix offers fastest setup for seasonal service pages. Framer provides stunning before/after sliders that justify premium pricing for high-end projects.

Choose Squarespace if: You want professional project galleries organized by category. You need service area maps for local SEO. You want Google Reviews integration. You're a full-service landscaping company.

Choose Wix if: You need to launch fast before peak season. You offer seasonal services (spring cleanup, snow removal). You want integrated booking for consultations. You're a seasonal services provider or lawn care service.

Choose Framer if: You want stunning before/after sliders. You target high-end residential projects ($25K+). You need fast load times for mobile traffic. You're a premium design/build firm.

THE WINNER FOR MOST LANDSCAPERS: SQUARESPACE

Professional project galleries + service area maps = qualified local leads. Proven to capture peak season revenue.
